channel.title: Penguinman on ZooBerry
channel.description: Recent content in Penguinman on ZooBerry

item.title: Adelie Penguin
item.description: A recolor of the Adelie Penguin by Electric Eel with help from SilesianTomcat and APE II.

item.title: Aye-Aye
item.description: A unique animal coded by Penguinman and skinned by Electric Eel. ES recommended for optimal performance.

item.title: Bobcat
item.description: A boreal cat native to North America.

item.title: Camargue Wild Horse
item.description: A European wetlands horse living in semi-wild conditions in the swampy areas of southern France.

item.title: Chinstrap Penguin
item.description: This penguin lives in the sub-Antarctic islands. Coded by Penguinman with skins by Electric Eel.

item.title: Fallow Deer
item.description: Here is the Fallow Deer. It is coded by Penguinman and beautifully recolored by Exitree. I hope you enjoy this European animal!

item.title: White-Flippered Penguin
item.description: One of the smallest penguin species alive today, with two variant skins.

item.title: Ambient Peafowl
item.description: An ambient peafowl that randomly appears in your zoo.

item.title: Ambient Sheep
item.description: An ambient sheep that randomly appears and moves through obstructions in your zoo.

item.title: Golden Dart Frog
item.description: The Golden Dart Frog is a bright yellow tropical amphibian, native to rainforests.

item.title: Himalayan Monal
item.description: An alpine-dwelling bird with vibrant plumage, native to the Himalayas.

item.title: Island Excursions
item.description: Embark upon an excursion to travel the oceans in search of tropical paradise! Discover the isles hiding within the Hawaiian Islands and Papua New Guinea, seeing such animals as the Hawaiian Monk Seal and the Northern Cassowary as they live in their lush and vibrant homes.

item.title: Alpine Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Binoculars Pack
item.description: This pack contains four binoculars.

item.title: Boreal Forest Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Desert Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Elements Pack
item.description: This is a scenery pack from the creative minds of Penguinman and Budgielover101.

item.title: Grassland Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Savannah Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Scrub Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Temperate Forest Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Tundra Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Aardwolf
item.description: Here is the Aardwolf! This African insectivore is coded by Penguinman and recolored by Exitree. Enjoy!

item.title: Afromontane Foliage
item.description: A set of trees from African mountains made to accompany the user-made Montane Forest biome!

item.title: Asian Small-Clawed Otter
item.description: The Asian Small-Clawed Otter is a wetlands mammal. It is smaller than the Sea Otter.

item.title: Atlantic Sailfish
item.description: The Atlantic Sailfish is uber amazing: It’s also AWESOME and POINTY! (quote from ShenTirag)

item.title: Australian Spotted Jellyfish
item.description: This large and spectacular jellyfish is common during the summer months in New South Wales coastal waters and estuaries, including Sydney Harbour.

item.title: Biome Shell
item.description: Alternatives have been released over the years, but this was the original modified biome system for Zoo Tycoon 2.

item.title: Black-Backed Jackal
item.description: These animals are omnivorous and will eat carrion, as well as plants such as grass, fruit, berries and seed.

item.title: Cannonball Jellyfish
item.description: The cannonball jellyfish, also known as the cabbagehead jellyfish, is a species of jellyfish in the family Stomolophidae.

item.title: Cross Jellyfish
item.description: This jelly is commonly seen in Monterey Bay during spring and summer, sometimes in large groups.

item.title: Deepwater Trachymedusa
item.description: Benthocodon pedunculata is found in deep water habitats like Monterey Canyon and San Clemente Basin on the West Coast.

item.title: Dik-Dik
item.description: The coat of Kirk’s dik-dik is an overall grizzled grey-brown to reddish brown, while the head and legs are tawny in colour.

item.title: Dingo
item.description: The dingo is an Australian wild dog living in various habitats, ranging from tropical coastal beaches, inland deserts or alpine forest.

item.title: Dwarf Cassowary
item.description: Casuarius bennetti is found on the island of New Guinea. The majority of the population resides in Papua New Guinea, on the eastern side of the island.

item.title: Flower Hat Jellyfish
item.description: This striking and rare jelly has brilliant, multicolored tentacles trailing from a translucent, pinstriped bell.

item.title: Fried Egg Jellyfish
item.description: This jellyfish resembles a fried egg when seen from above.

item.title: Granrojo
item.description: In photographs, it looks like a big red spaceship cruising the ocean depths.

item.title: Gray's Monitor
item.description: Gray’s monitor gets its common name from its previous scientific name of Varanus grayi.

item.title: Greater Kudu
item.description: This is the Greater Kudu, the second largest antelope in Africa.

item.title: Jackson's Mongoose
item.description: Jackson’s mongooses are typically a greyish or dull brownish in color, with the legs being black.

item.title: Leopard Tortoise
item.description: Leopard tortoises have a huge range, being found on the savannahs of Africa from the Sudan South to the Cape Province of South Africa.

item.title: Lion's Mane Jellyfish
item.description: The lion’s mane jellyfish can be found in the cooler regions of the Atlantic, Pacific, North Sea and Baltic.

item.title: Maned Wolf
item.description: A South American savannah-dwelling canid with one variant skin.

item.title: Mauve Stinger
item.description: This species of jellyfish, commonly known as mauve stinger, is widely distributed in all warm and temperate waters.

item.title: Montane Forest
item.description: Montane forests are a type of tropical moist forest that exist at higher elevations.

item.title: Montane Forest Hack
item.description: This will move the spectacled bear, mountain gorilla, and puya plant to the Montane Forest biome.

item.title: Purple-Striped Jellyfish
item.description: Of all the gelatinous creatures visiting Monterey Bay, the purple-striped jelly is certainly among the most recognizable and spectacular.

item.title: Purple-Striped Jellyfish
item.description: Of all the gelatinous creatures visiting Monterey Bay, the purple-striped jelly is certainly among the most recognizable and spectacular.

item.title: Red-Footed Tortoise
item.description: Also known as the South American red-footed tortoise, the males grow up to 13.5 inches (30.4 cm) and are somewhat larger than females.

item.title: Red-Footed Tortoise
item.description: Also known as the South American red-footed tortoise, the males grow up to 13.5 inches (30.4 cm) and are somewhat larger than females.

item.title: South America Pack
item.description: This pack contains six animals from South America and is downloaded in one file.

item.title: Wax Palm
item.description: The wax palm (Palma de cera del quindio in Spanish) is not only the tallest palm, but the tallest monocot in the world.

item.title: Yellow Jellyfish
item.description: Due to their extreme rarity, very little is known about the yellow jellyfish.

item.title: Yellow-Footed Rock Wallaby
item.description: The yellow-footed rock wallaby is one of the brightest members of the kangaroo family.

item.title: Zorilla
item.description: The zorilla is a skunk-like mammal that lives in African savannas. It is also called the striped polecat.

item.title: American Badger
item.description: A white dorsal stripe extends back over the head from the nose of the American badger.

item.title: Clouded Leopard
item.description: A tropical rainforest cat from Southeast Asia. This amazing tropical rainforest cat is coded by Penguinman and recolored by Exitree. Enjoy!

item.title: Eurasian Badger
item.description: Eurasian badgers are easily recognisable by the conspicuous black and white stripes running from the nose to the shoulders.

item.title: Red River Hog Pack
item.description: Red river hogs are social animals. While adults of both sexes have been known to be solitary, most live in small groups of up to eleven individuals.

item.title: Skunk
item.description: Skunks produce a very smelly spray that repels most predators. This oily, yellow liquid is produced in two glands located under the tail.

item.title: Skunk
item.description: Skunks produce a very smelly spray that repels most predators. This oily, yellow liquid is produced in two glands located under the tail.

item.title: Sorraia
item.description: Sorraia horses are a remnant population of an indigenous, South Iberian wild horse.

item.title: Sorraia
item.description: Sorraia horses are a remnant population of an indigenous, South Iberian wild horse.

item.title: Yunnan White-Handed Gibbon
item.description: This Yunnan white-handed gibbon was a subspecies of the lar gibbon located in the Yunnan province of China.

item.title: Chamois
item.description: They live in rocky areas and alpine meadows in Europe (especially the Alps, Carpathians) and in Asia minor.

item.title: Eastern Cougar
item.description: Here is the Eastern Cougar. This cat is colored by August and coded by Penguinman! Enjoy!

item.title: Japanese Macaque Pack
item.description: Japanese macaques range through the forested mountains and highlands of Japan.

item.title: Japanese Serow
item.description: A single-horned Asian rhinoceros, coded by Penguinman and skinned by Koala Komander.

item.title: Vicuña Pack
item.description: Vicuñas are found in semiarid rolling grasslands and plains at altitudes of 3,500-5,750 meters.

item.title: Desert Themed Elevated Path
item.description: Part of a set of elevated paths made to match the vanilla game’s building themes, in this case the Desert Theme from African Adventure.

item.title: Endangered Species Themed Elevated Path
item.description: Part of a set of elevated paths made to match the vanilla game’s building themes, in this case the Endangered Theme from Endangered Species.

item.title: Extinct Themed Elevated Path
item.description: Part of a set of elevated paths made to match the vanilla game’s building themes, in this case the Extinct Theme from Extinct Animals.

item.title: Jungle Themed Elevated Path
item.description: Part of a set of elevated paths made to match the vanilla game’s building themes, in this case the Jungle Theme from base Zoo Tycoon 2.

item.title: Safari Themed Elevated Path
item.description: Part of a set of elevated paths made to match the vanilla game’s building themes, in this case the Safari Theme from base Zoo Tycoon 2.

item.title: Tundra Themed Elevated Path
item.description: Part of a set of elevated paths made to match the vanilla game’s building themes, in this case the Tundra Theme from official bonus downloads.

item.title: American Alligator Pack
item.description: American alligators are usually found in freshwater swamps, marshes, rivers, lakes, and occasionally smaller bodies of water.

item.title: Ganges River Dolphin Pack
item.description: The Ganges river dolphin lives in the muddy waters of the Ganges, Brahmaputra, Meghna, Karnaphuli, and Hoogly river systems.

item.title: Indian Mango Tree
item.description: An Asian fruit tree. This beautiful mango variety lives in the Indian scrublands.

item.title: Tamarind Tree
item.description: This wonderful tree will be great in Scrub and Tropical Rainforest exhibits with animals from Asia, Africa or Central America..

item.title: Fire Pack
item.description: From the hidden island of Drom emerges mythical beasts of fire.

item.title: Gibbon Pack
item.description: A pack of three different gibbons to bring some variety to your zoos’ primate sections.

item.title: Lesser Flamingo
item.description: The lesser flamingo is herbivorous, feeding solely on a blue-green algae growing within a very limited range of pH.

item.title: Ornate Box Turtle
item.description: The ornate box turtle is one of two turtle species on the Great Plains that are terrestrial.

item.title: Red Deer
item.description: Red deer have a reddish-brown coat, which changes to a brownish-grey in the winter.

item.title: Red Deer
item.description: Red deer have a reddish-brown coat, which changes to a brownish-grey in the winter.

item.title: Slender-horned Gazelle
item.description: The slender-horned gazelle is the palest gazelle species, with a cream or yellow-white coloured body.

item.title: Slender-horned Gazelle
item.description: The slender-horned gazelle is the palest gazelle species, with a cream or yellow-white coloured body.

item.title: Tree Elevated Path Pack
item.description: This pack contains 9 elevated paths, each made to resemble a tree from a different biome.

item.title: ZT2DC Gazebo
item.description: This download was created as a collaboration between many members for the first Skinning Collage Event at ZT2DC.

item.title: Blue Poison Dart Frog
item.description: These little frogs are easily recognized by their blue color, which is generally darker on the limbs and belly and overlaid with black spots or patches.

item.title: Blue Roo
item.description: The Blue Kangaroo live in Tasmania and Australia and is happy in many biomes.

item.title: Mainland Serow
item.description: The serow lives alone or in small groups. It is attached to its territory, which usually covers just a few miles square.

item.title: Red Eyed Tree Frog
item.description: A vibrant tree frog native to Central and South America, known for its bright red eyes.

item.title: Red Eyed Tree Frog
item.description: A vibrant tree frog native to Central and South America, known for its bright red eyes.

item.title: Strawberry Dart Frog
item.description: The strawberry poison dart frog is common in the Atlantic lowland tropical forests of Central America.

item.title: Strawberry Dart Frog
item.description: The strawberry poison dart frog is common in the Atlantic lowland tropical forests of Central America.

item.title: Arctic Fox
item.description: Arctic foxes are pure white in winter and grey-brown in summer. They can also be light brown, grey, chocolate, or black with a bluish hue.

item.title: Black Lion
item.description: A black coloration of the lion. This animal is recolored by Howling Shadow Wolf with coding by both Howling Shadow Wolf and Penguinman. I hope you enjoy it!

item.title: Phoenix
item.description: The phoenix was originally believed to be a myth, until a group of American scientists discovered a large flock several hundred miles south of Egypt.

item.title: Spotted Hyena
item.description: Spotted hyenas are the largest member of the family Hyaenidae. This family also includes three other hyena species.

item.title: Spotted Hyena
item.description: Spotted hyenas are the largest member of the family Hyaenidae. This family also includes three other hyena species.

item.title: Wisent
item.description: This ungulate is also known as the European bison. Some authors consider it and the American bison to be conspecific.

item.title: African Bullfrog
item.description: A large species of frog from over a dozen African countries.

item.title: Bat Eared Fox
item.description: These foxes live in the scrub, savannah and grasslands of Africa.

item.title: Black Bear
item.description: The North American black bear is the best known and most widespread of the North American bears.

item.title: Bonobo
item.description: Bonobos live in the forests located centrally in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (formerly Zaire).

item.title: Bornean Pygmy Elephant
item.description: Borneo pygmy elephants have significantly different characteristics from their cousins found on mainland Asia and Sumatra.

item.title: Chacoan Peccary
item.description: The Chacoan peccary’s bristly coat is a speckled charcoal or brownish-grey, interspersed with long guard hairs.

item.title: Common Dolphin
item.description: Common dolphins can be found throughout the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans.

item.title: Crocodile Monitor
item.description: Generally arboreal, or tree dwelling. Crocodile monitors inhabit rainforests and adjacent savannas.

item.title: European Lion
item.description: Due to their remote extinction, little is known about this subspecies of lion.

item.title: Fire-bellied Toad
item.description: Despite the remarkably vivid coloring of its underbelly, the Oriental fire-bellied toad merges perfectly with its surroundings.

item.title: Jurrasic Bench
item.description: This bench will go perfectly alongside your Jurassic period species.

item.title: Lemur Donation Box
item.description: This donation box has a lemur instead of a monkey as well as the animals from Madagascar, the movie.

item.title: Mini Volcano
item.description: Guests will love this mini form of the volcano, especially when it is erupting steam.

item.title: Nile Monitor Lizard
item.description: The Nile monitor is distributed across most of Africa, except the northwest.

item.title: Piranha
item.description: These piranhas will form interesting schools in your jungle tanks.

item.title: Red Fox II
item.description: Red foxes are native to the Nearctic, Palearctic, Oriental, and Ethiopian regions, and have been introduced to areas in the Australian region.

item.title: Red Fox II
item.description: Red foxes are native to the Nearctic, Palearctic, Oriental, and Ethiopian regions, and have been introduced to areas in the Australian region.

item.title: Sloth Bear
item.description: Sloth bears live in the tropical rainforest of India.

item.title: Sloth Bear
item.description: Sloth bears live in the tropical rainforest of India.

item.title: Stone Table
item.description: A table made of stone for guests to eat on.

item.title: Yacare Caiman
item.description: The yacare caiman is found in a variety of habitat types, often associated with floating mats of vegetation.

item.title: Zoo History Board
item.description: A board which shows the history of the zoo for guests to see.

item.title: Presently-Seated Bench
item.description: Download the Presently Seated Bench, a festive holiday bench

item.title: Churro Stand
item.description: Churros are a fun Mexican pastry with lots of sugar!

item.title: Glass Fence
item.description: This is the an all glass fence created by Gibbon-Fanatic with help from Penguinman. Enjoy!

item.title: Insect Dish
item.description: This is a dish containing insects to be eaten from by insectivores.

item.title: Giant Bamboo
item.description: This is a larger version of the water bamboo to create bamboo forests.

item.title: Duckweed, Square
item.description: This plant floats on the water.

item.title: Duckweed, Round
item.description: This plant floats on the water.

item.title: AA Photo Stand
item.description: This stand contains photos of each of the 20 animals featured in the African Adventures expansion pack.

item.title: Fantasy Wolf
item.description: These boreal forest wolves enjoy eating a variety of foods including bananas, berries, insects, fish, and meat.

item.title: Indian Rhinoceros I
item.description: An Indian rhino for your zoo. Recolored from the Javan rhino.

item.title: DL File Tutorial
item.description: DL File Tutorial To begin, you need to come up with two words/phrases. The first is your File Name hereafter referred to as FN. This is basically what the download is. This could, for instance, be Red Kangaroo, Australia Pack, or Aboriginal Lamp. It simply describes the download. Any place you see FN in the zip you download, put that word or phrase. The second is UN which stands for User Name.

item.title: Object Creation Tutorial
item.description: Object Creation Tutorial This guide is for objects such as trash cans, benches, tables etc. This guide can help, but is not meant for plants. Step 1: The entities folder Part 1: Gathering the files To begin, go to C:Program Files/Microsoft Games/Zoo Tycoon 2. If the object you would like to make is based off an Endangered Species object, then you must use the x100_000 file. If it is not, then use the entities file.

item.title: Ambient Accumulation Guide
item.description: Ambient Accumulation Guide In this tutorial you will be creating ambient animals, but you MUST create it based off an existing ambient animal. Now is the time to figure that out and from now on it will be referred to as the base animal. Also, you should know that the 2 folders contained in the download called entities and world will be referred to as your files. Section I: Gathering the Files The first thing you must do is get the files that you will be editing.

item.title: Variant Assembly Tutorial
item.description: Variant Assembly Tutorial Welcome to VAT, a guide made by penguinman to help you create a variant skin for an animal in ZT2. This will only work for members with the Endangered Species (ES) expansion pack. Before we begin, there are some programs you will want. One thing you must have is an extracting program. WinRar and WinZip are highly recommended free downloads which serve this purpose. The second one is called DxtBmp and it is so useful during the re-coloring stage.
